page.title: 18International Ferry Terminal
page.content: The international ferry terminal has been in use since the early sixties. On the quay there are warehouses for cargo. The P & O ferries have frequently used the Princess Alexandria dock. There is an old railway line which runs through the quays which was at one time used to distribute cargo to the port's warehouses. The warehouses have been renovated since the war and are still in use. The docks have been rebuilt in parts: there are new car ramps and the quay has been renewed. The Itchen area consists mainly of public houses, warehouses and works. There is a major development scheme for the area beneath the Itchen Bridge. The waters of the river are green and muddy.
